trial.title: Long-term Radial Artery Occlusion in Coronary Diagnosis and Intervention Via Distal Radial Approach (CONDITION)
trial.description: This study compares long-term radial artery occlusion in coronary diagnosis and intervention using distal versus conventional radial approaches.

overview.purpose: To investigate the long-term effects of radial artery occlusion after coronary procedures using different access methods.
overview.participant_commitment: Participants will be involved for approximately 3 months with follow-up visits.
key_procedures: Ultrasound examination of the radial artery

studies.contact_info: Study conducted at various locations. Enrolling 801 participants (completed). Contact details not provided. Study ran from March 2022 to March 2023.

criteria.text: Age 18 years and older
criteria.question: Can you confirm that you are at least 18 years old?

criteria.text: Palpable unilateral distal radial and radial artery
criteria.question: Do you have a palpable radial artery in your arm?

trial.title: Aripiprazole for the Treatment of Patients With Agitation Associated With Dementia of the Alzheimer's Type
trial.description: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of aripiprazole in treating agitation in patients with Alzheimer's type dementia.

overview.purpose: To determine if aripiprazole can effectively reduce agitation in patients with Alzheimer's disease.
overview.participant_commitment: Approximately 10 weeks of treatment and 30 days of post-treatment observation.

studies.contact_info: Conducted at multiple centers. Enrolling 150 participants (currently terminated). For more information, contact the research team.

criteria.text: Age between 55 and 89 years
criteria.question: Can you tell me your age?

criteria.text: Diagnosis of major neurocognitive disorder due to Alzheimer's disease
criteria.question: Have you been diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease or a related disorder?

criteria.text: Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) score between 1 and 22
criteria.question: What was your most recent Mini-Mental State Examination score?

criteria.text: Legal representative can provide informed consent
criteria.question: Is there someone who can help provide informed consent for your participation?
criteria.expected_response: Yes, I have a legal representative

criteria.text: Hospitalized or residing in a care facility
criteria.question: Are you currently hospitalized or living in a care facility?
criteria.expected_response: Yes, I am in a care facility

criteria.text: No history of severe complications related to dementia
criteria.question: Do you have any complications from dementia that are not related to Alzheimer's?
criteria.expected_response: No complications from other types of dementia

criteria.text: Available for all study visits over 10 weeks
criteria.question: Will you be able to attend all required visits over the next 10 weeks?

criteria.text: No participation in another clinical trial within the last 30 days
criteria.question: Have you participated in any other clinical trials in the past month?

trial.title: Effects of Laugh Therapy Associated to Cardiopulmonary Rehab
trial.description: This study investigates the impact of laugh therapy combined with cardiopulmonary rehabilitation on patients with ischemic heart disease.
trial.sponsor: Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre

overview.purpose: To determine if laugh therapy can improve the quality of life and physiological parameters in patients with ischemic heart disease.
overview.participant_commitment: Approximately 6 months with bi-weekly visits for therapy sessions.

studies.contact_info: Study conducted at Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre, Brazil. Enrolling 40 participants (currently recruiting). Contact: Cardiology Research Department, +55-51-3359-8000. Principal Investigator: Dr. Silva. Study runs Jan 2024 - Dec 2024.

criteria.text: Age between 40 and 80 years
criteria.question: Can you tell me your age?

criteria.text: Diagnosis of ischemic heart disease confirmed by cardiac catheterization
criteria.question: Have you been diagnosed with ischemic heart disease through cardiac catheterization?

criteria.text: Willingness to attend therapy sessions twice a week
criteria.question: Are you able to come to the hospital for therapy sessions twice a week?
criteria.expected_response: Yes, available for twice a week

criteria.text: No participation in another clinical trial
criteria.question: Are you currently participating in any other clinical trials?

criteria.text: No severe lung disease or major psychiatric disorders
criteria.question: Do you have any severe lung disease or major psychiatric conditions like depression or bipolar disorder?
criteria.expected_response: No severe lung or psychiatric conditions

criteria.text: Ability to understand the consent form
criteria.question: Do you feel comfortable understanding the consent form for this study?
criteria.expected_response: Yes, I can understand the consent form

criteria.text: No chronic renal failure or active infections
criteria.question: Do you have any chronic kidney issues or active infections?
criteria.expected_response: No chronic renal failure or active infections

trial.title: The Effect of the 3/7 vs 3X9 Method in Resistance Training on Metabolic Stress in Cardiac Rehabilitation
trial.description: This study investigates the effects of two resistance training methods on biological markers in patients with heart failure and coronary artery disease.

overview.purpose: To compare the effects of different resistance training methods on metabolic stress in patients undergoing cardiac rehabilitation.
overview.participant_commitment: Participants will attend two testing sessions, spaced 2 to 10 days apart.
key_procedures: Blood sample collection before and after exercises

studies.contact_info: Study conducted at Cardiac Rehabilitation Research Institute. Enrolling 25 male participants. Contact: Dr. Smith, (555) 123-4567. Study runs Feb 2022 - Jun 2022.

criteria.text: Age 18 years or older
criteria.question: Can you confirm that you are at least 18 years old?

criteria.text: Clinical diagnosis of coronary artery disease
criteria.question: Have you been diagnosed with coronary artery disease?

criteria.text: Heart failure with reduced ejection fraction
criteria.question: Do you have heart failure with reduced ejection fraction?

criteria.text: No history of angina
criteria.question: Have you experienced angina or chest pain?
criteria.expected_response: No, I have not experienced angina

criteria.text: No acutely decompensated heart failure
criteria.question: Have you had any recent episodes of worsening heart failure?
criteria.expected_response: No, I have not had recent episodes

criteria.text: No significant orthopedic or neurologic disorders that limit exercise
criteria.question: Do you have any orthopedic or neurologic issues that would limit your ability to exercise?
criteria.expected_response: No, I do not have such issues

criteria.text: Available for all study visits
criteria.question: Are you available to attend all required study visits?
criteria.expected_response: Yes, I can attend all visits

criteria.text: Willing to provide informed consent
criteria.question: Are you willing to sign the informed consent form to participate in this study?
criteria.expected_response: Yes, I am willing to sign

trial.title: Surgical Stages of Liver Cirrhosis In Patients With Hepatocellular Carcinoma
trial.description: This study aims to establish clinical criteria for surgical stages of liver cirrhosis to guide treatment for hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).

overview.purpose: To evaluate the severity of liver cirrhosis and its impact on surgical treatment for patients with hepatocellular carcinoma.
overview.participant_commitment: Approximately 1 year with multiple clinic visits.

criteria.text: Age 18 – 75 years (inclusive)
criteria.question: How old are you?

criteria.text: Clinically diagnosed with hepatocellular carcinoma confirmed by pathology
criteria.question: Have you been diagnosed with hepatocellular carcinoma?

criteria.text: Liver function grade Child-Pugh class A or B
criteria.question: What is your current liver function grade?

criteria.text: Ability to undergo open surgery
criteria.question: Are you able to undergo open surgery?
criteria.expected_response: Yes, I can undergo open surgery

criteria.text: No serious physical diseases that affect surgery
criteria.question: Do you have any serious health conditions that might affect your ability to have surgery?

criteria.text: Willingness to sign informed consent
criteria.question: Are you willing to sign a consent form for this study?
criteria.expected_response: Yes, I am willing to sign

criteria.text: No participation in other clinical trials within the last 30 days
criteria.question: Have you participated in any other clinical trials in the past month?

trial.title: Study Evaluating The Safety And Efficacy Of PF-05212377 Or Placebo In Subjects With Alzheimer's Disease With Existing Neuropsychiatric Symptoms On Donepezil
trial.description: This study evaluates the safety and efficacy of PF-05212377 in subjects with mild-to-moderate Alzheimer's Disease experiencing neuropsychiatric symptoms.

overview.purpose: To test if PF-05212377 improves cognitive and neuropsychiatric symptoms in individuals with Alzheimer's Disease already on Donepezil.
overview.participant_commitment: Approximately 18 weeks with multiple clinic visits.

criteria.text: Age 60 years or older
criteria.question: How old are you?

trial.title: Clinical Effect of No-touch Harvesting Technique in OPCABG
trial.description: This study investigates the clinical effect of the No-touch saphenous vein harvesting technique in off-pump coronary artery bypass grafting (OPCABG) compared to the conventional technique.

overview.purpose: To determine if the No-touch vein harvesting technique improves graft patency compared to conventional methods in patients undergoing OPCABG.
overview.participant_commitment: Approximately 6 months with follow-up visits at 3 months post-surgery.
key_procedures: Graft harvesting using No-touch or conventional technique
CTA to evaluate graft patency at 3 months

criteria.text: Age between 18 and 70 years
criteria.question: How old are you?

criteria.text: First-time isolated off-pump coronary artery bypass graft surgery
criteria.question: Is this your first time undergoing off-pump coronary artery bypass graft surgery?
criteria.expected_response: Yes, it is my first time

criteria.text: Ejection fraction greater than 35%
criteria.question: What is your most recent ejection fraction percentage?

criteria.text: Diameter of saphenous vein is at least 2mm
criteria.question: What is the diameter of your saphenous vein?

criteria.text: Willingness to sign informed consent
criteria.question: Are you willing to sign the informed consent form for this study?
criteria.expected_response: Yes, I am willing to sign

criteria.text: No urgent surgery required
criteria.question: Do you require any urgent surgery at this time?
criteria.expected_response: No, I do not require urgent surgery

criteria.text: No severe renal insufficiency
criteria.question: Do you have any issues with your kidneys, such as severe renal insufficiency?
criteria.expected_response: No, I do not have severe renal issues

criteria.text: No allergy to radiocontrast agents
criteria.question: Are you allergic to any radiocontrast agents?

criteria.text: No history of malignant tumors or severe systemic conditions
criteria.question: Do you have a history of any malignant tumors or severe systemic health issues?
criteria.expected_response: No, I do not have such a history
